comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: At the corner of Princes and Little Essex Streets (see gaslamp with the Persistent URL).

comment.author: 46999332@N05
comment._content:
black and white pics makes you almost nostalgic, even if you're too young to have actually experienced it...

this other picture i found shows how life was so much simpler and relaxed compared to today's... check it out

    [http://www.flickr.com/photos/70458924@N00/3947532063/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The date "11-9-01" appears at bottom left of photo, as on several of these unattributed photos of The Rocks in the PhM collection and the State Records NSW photostream.

11 September 1901 was a Wednesday.  Coincidently exactly 100 years before 9/11 2001.  You are right, GingerALee, that life was so much simpler and relaxed.

comment.author: 94819078@N02
comment._content: Hi, does anyone know if the Wesleyan Church on Princes Street can be spotted in any of these photos? Thanks. :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/94819078@N02] State Records NSW have a fine collection of Princes Street photos, but I only remember two showing the Wesleyan Church (or chapel) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5061232880/
